decision_conditions: Reason : 1 - The proposed raised platform would measure 0.53m thereby exceeding the 0.3m threshold permitted under Class A of Schedule 2, Part 1(k) of the General Permitted Development Order 2015 (as amended). In addition the eaves height of the extension would exceed 3m, in conflict with Class A of Schedule 2, Part 1(i) of the General Permitted Development Order 2015 (as amended).

Reason : 2 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton  (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:
"	Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
"	Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
"	As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.
In this instance:
" The application did not comply with the requirements under Class A of Schedule 2, Parts 1(i) and (k) of the General Permitted Development Order 2015.
description: APPLICATION FOR PRIOR APPROVAL IN RESPECT OF THE PROPOSED ERECTION OF A SINGLE STOREY REAR EXTENSION WITH THE FOLLOWING DIMENSIONS: EXTENDS BEYOND THE REAR WALL OF THE ORIGINAL DWELLINGHOUSE BY 6 METRES. THE MAXIMUM HEIGHT OF THE ENLARGED PART OF THE DWELLINGHOUSE WILL BE 3.32 METRES. THE HEIGHT OF THE EAVES OF THE ENLARGED PART OF THE DWELLINGHOUSE WILL BE 3 METRES.
